definition: letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
dawn/morning/daybreak/day/dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
dawn/morning/daybreak/day/dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)

sentences.english: Though you have solemnly vowed yourself loyal to His Majesty's Court.
sentences.chinese: 丞相信誓旦旦說自己沒有篡奪漢室之意。

sentences.english: Yuan Shih-Kai once promised to uphold Republican principles.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凱曾經信誓旦旦，說要堅持共和原則。

sentences.english: While you begin to Ti unexpectedly gentle pledged to do violence eccentric and unreasonable later become disobedient.
sentences.chinese: 雖然你開始信誓旦旦溫存倜儻，可後來變得忤戾乖張。

sentences.english: She vowed that she would take the matter to court.
sentences.chinese: 她信誓旦旦地說一定要把此事告到法庭。

sentences.english: Wu Maxue vowed to solve the problems in the house before the birth of children.
sentences.chinese: 馬學武信誓旦旦要在孩子出生前解決房子問題。

sentences.english: Many health mavens swear by wheatgrass as a super food.
sentences.chinese: 許多健康專家信誓旦旦稱麥草是一種神奇的食物。

sentences.english: Often vowed to lose weight, but it always has been too hasty.
sentences.chinese: 每每信誓旦旦要減肥，卻總是草草了事。

sentences.english: In saying that, promises, a sense of days vividly.
sentences.chinese: 說的時候，信誓旦旦，感天動地。

sentences.english: He pledged in all sincerity and seriousness that he would always remain faithful.
sentences.chinese: 他信誓旦旦地保證，他將永遠忠貞不渝。

definition: see 誇海口|夸海口[kua1 hai3 kou3]
lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
lit. to eat one's words/to break a promise/to go back on one's word/to renege/unsworn testimony
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
